meanings.definition: To restore to a good state of repair.
meanings.sent1: My parents are renovating our old house to make it look nice again.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers are renovating the building to fix all the broken parts.
meanings.sent3: The handyman joked that he was renovating the squeaky door to give it a new lease on life.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was renovating her life, just like the old house, piece by piece.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays were renovating the garden, bringing life back to the wilted flowers.

meanings.definition: To make new or as if new again.
meanings.sent1: The artist is renovating the mural on the wall to make it vibrant once more.
meanings.sent2: After renovating the furniture, it looked brand new and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The chef was renovating the recipe, adding a modern twist to an old classic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like renovating the room, filling it with joy and brightness.
meanings.sent5: The rain was renovating the dry earth, turning it into a fresh, new canvas for life.

meanings.sent1: Taking a nap can renovate your energy levels and make you feel more awake.
meanings.sent2: The cool breeze was renovating the stuffy room, making it feel more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were renovating the mood of the audience, turning frowns into smiles.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like renovating the spirit, bringing hope and positivity.
meanings.sent5: The music was renovating her spirit, lifting her mood and filling her with renewed vigor.
